title: installation issue: system-shipped libstdc++ leaked while bootstrapping CMake

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
In the process of installing `cmake%gcc@8.3.0`, it looks like the bootstrapped `cmake` command has been correctly built against `gcc@8.3.0`'s own `libstdc++` while the build environment makes the dynamic linker to find the system-shipped `/lib64/libstdc++.so.6` instead (which seems to be too old to provide the same versioned symbols):

```console
$ spack install cmake%gcc@8.3.0
...
/gpfs/scratch/userinternal/fficarel/spack/build/spack-stage/spack-stage-7sL976/cmake-3.14.2/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake: /lib64/libstdc++.so.6: v
            ersion `GLIBCXX_3.4.20' not found (required by /gpfs/scratch/userinternal/fficarel/spack/build/spack-stage/spack-stage-7sL976/cmake-3.14.
            2/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake)
...
```

Please note that neither adding `+ownlibs` variant nor trying with different versions of `gcc` (`8.2.0` and `7.3.0`) changes this behaviour.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install gcc@8.3.0
$ spack compiler find $(spack location -i gcc@8.3.0)
$ spack install cmake%gcc@8.3.0
```

Parsing the output for errors I end up with:

```console
$ cd $(spack location -s cmake%gcc@8.3.0)
$ spack log-parse --show=errors,warnings spack-build.out
1 errors
0 warnings
     226    /gpfs/scratch/userinternal/fficarel/spack/build/spack-stage/spack-stage-7sL976/cmake-3.14.2/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake: /lib64/libstdc++.so.6: v
            ersion `GLIBCXX_3.4.20' not found (required by /gpfs/scratch/userinternal/fficarel/spack/build/spack-stage/spack-stage-7sL976/cmake-3.14.
            2/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake)
     227    /gpfs/scratch/userinternal/fficarel/spack/build/spack-stage/spack-stage-7sL976/cmake-3.14.2/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake: /lib64/libstdc++.so.6: v
            ersion `GLIBCXX_3.4.21' not found (required by /gpfs/scratch/userinternal/fficarel/spack/build/spack-stage/spack-stage-7sL976/cmake-3.14.
            2/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake)
     228    ---------------------------------------------
  >> 229    Error when bootstrapping CMake:
     230    Problem while running initial CMake
     231    ---------------------------------------------
```


### Platform and user environment

```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux node166 3.10.0-327.36.3.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Oct 24 16:09:20 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	CentOS Linux release 7.0.1406 (Core)
``` 

### Additional information

```console
$ spack spec --install-status cmake%gcc@8.3.0
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   cmake%gcc@8.3.0

Concretized
--------------------------------
 -   cmake@3.14.2%gcc@8.3.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]      ^ncurses@6.1%gcc@8.3.0~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]          ^pkgconf@1.6.0%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]      ^openssl@1.1.1b%gcc@8.3.0+systemcerts arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]          ^perl@5.26.2%gcc@8.3.0+cpanm patches=0eac10ed90aeb0459ad8851f88081d439a4e41978e586ec743069e8b059370ac +shared+threads arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]              ^gdbm@1.18.1%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]                  ^readline@7.0%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]          ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@8.3.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
```

The build environment looks quite tidy:

```console
$ cd $(spack location -s cmake%gcc@8.3.0)
$ grep lib64 spack-build.env
export SPACK_SYSTEM_DIRS="/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/local/bin:/bin64:/usr/bin64:/usr/local/bin64:/include:/usr/include:/usr/local/include:/lib:/usr/lib:/usr/
e
```

Please find debug logs, `compilers.yaml` and `spack-build.out` [here](https://gist.github.com/nazavode/3fe3165f1f762f1b04dd563b754ec01d).

Pinging @alalazo  that pointed me to #11188 which looks like a plausible cause for this.
